moves.1. Nf3: As I know very little about the Reti opening, I'll choose my next moves in the  database.
moves.1... Nf6 2. b3 d5 3. Bb2 Bg4 4. d3: At this point, I wonder if the b knight has to come on d7 or c6
moves.4... Nbd7: I finally opt for 4. ... Nd7 Sir Perceval is going to protect his fellow Lancelot.
moves.5. Ne5: The white knight is challenging Perceval.
moves.5... Nxe5: No real choice. Perceval must accept all challenges
moves.6. Bxe5: Black has no way to fire the bishop immediately.
moves.6... e6: So that Dame Guenièvre can protect her faithfull Lancelot. Black has now 4 pieces out against 3 for white.
moves.7. h3: The bishop has little places to go.
moves.7... Bh5: Carrying on pinning the white Lady.
moves.8... Bd6: I want to get rid of the anoying ecclesiastic
moves.9. Bc3: I'm not sure it's a very good move : the bishop is unprotected.
moves.9... e5: Black's plan is to take full control of the center.
moves.11. Bd2 h6: So that white's DSB is blocked on both diagonals.
moves.12. Nh4 e4: If 13. dxe4 Nxe4 and the white knight is under menace of Dame Guenièvre. If she can come to f6, there is a mating menace by a further Qxf2
moves.13. Nf5: White sees the trap and sends his brave knight in the middle of the ennemies... Paradoxically, the safest place.
moves.14. Nxd4: So that the knight kills the poor d4 soldier...
moves.14... Be5: ... and is pinned to the rook
moves.17. exd3: White is ahead again in material but has a weak king.
moves.18. Be3: It doesn't prevent Bxd4 but provides an escape to the king.
moves.19... Qxd4: Dame Guenièvre charges in the middle of the battle
moves.20... Qc3+: White has only one move available if he wants to castle
moves.21... Rad8: Aiming at the queen. Material equality, the white king is unsafe, Black controls the open and semi open files, and indirectly the center (all his pieces are aiming at it). Black's pawn structure is better (white has an isolated pawn) and black pieces are better connected. Black's plan is to fully destroy white's e and d pieces to cut white army in two.
moves.22... Qe5: Protecting c7 and preparing an attack on the DSB.
moves.23... Nd5: But it doesn't change black's plan
moves.24. Qc1: Ptotecting the c rook and the DSB
moves.24... Nxe3+: Lancelot charges furiously under the eyes of his true love...
moves.25... Qf6+: Dame Guenièvre is sad but doesn't attack foolhardy.
moves.26... Bxd3: Black's plan has not change : eliminate the central white pieces.
moves.28. Bxd3: At least, this move doens't surprise me (many previous moves by white were unforeseen).
moves.28... Rxd3: White can take the c pawn but black has now mating menaces.
moves.29. Rxc7: I'm not sure it's a good move, black will have a very strong attack. 29. Rc2 might have been better.
moves.29... Qd5+: At this point, I hoped it was the final attack.
moves.31. Rc8+: Countering, but white cannot get further
moves.31... Kh7: I do not think white can avoid the mate, except by trading his queen against a rook.
moves.32. Qc2: Pinning the rook but black doesn't need to move it - Mate in 5
moves.32... Reg3+: White submits here. I add the mate.
